titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
Nora G. Frisbie papers,1918-1982 (scattered dates).
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Len Coombs

did.abstract: Her uncle, Robert Granville served as a sergeant, 337th Field Hospital in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes two papers, 1982, consisting of typescripts of letters of Robert Granville, written while in military training at Camp Custer, 1917-1918, and as a member of the Polar Bear expedition; also scattered clippings, and photograph.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Nora G. Frisbie, of Claremont, California, in 1982 (Donor no.: 6839).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Nora G. Frisbie papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

scopecontent.p: The paper includes biographical information about Frisbie's uncle, Robert Granville, who served as sergeant, 337th Field Hospital, and transcriptions of several of his letters, Nov. 1917-March 1919. The letters include descriptions of army life at Camp Custer, his daily routine at Archangel, and the Russian people and their customs. A photograph of Granville is also included.
